## ATypedArrayTuple.reduce() method

Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
abstract reduce(callbackfn: (previousValue: number, currentValue: number, currentIndex: number, array: T) => number): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  callbackfn | (previousValue: number, currentValue: number, currentIndex: number, array: T) =&gt; number | A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array. |

<b>Returns:</b>

number
